alert.note: Alert for Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:04AM EST until February 20 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Tompkins. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 AM EST, emergency management reported an ice jam near the warned area. Backwater was increasing behind the jam, and flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. If the ice jam abruptly releases, the one lane bridge and other foot bridges downstream in the Forest Home area will be in jeopardy. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forest Home and Northeast Ithaca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
